19.45. Let G be a group generated by 3 class transpositions (see the definition in 17.57), and let m be the least common multiple of the moduli of the residue classes interchanged by the generators of G. Assume that G does not setwisely stabilize any union of residue classes modulo m except for ∅ and Z, and assume that the integers 0, 1, . . . , 42 all lie in the same orbit under the action of G on Z. Is the action of G on N ∪ {0} necessarily transitive?

The bound 42 cannot be replaced by a smaller number, since the finite group ⟨τ0(2),1(2), τ0(3),2(3), τ0(7),6(7)⟩ acts transitively on the set {0, . . . , 41}, as well as on the set of residue classes modulo 42.

S. Kohl
